item.title: Anthropic has to keep revising its technical interview test so you can’t cheat on it with Claude
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: Since 2024, Anthropic's performance optimization team has given job seekers a take-home test to make sure they know their stuff — but as AI coding tools have gotten better, the test has had to change a lot to stay ahead of AI-assisted cheating.

item.title: Blue Origin schedules third New Glenn launch for late February, but not to the moon
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Jeff Bezos' Blue Origin had previously suggested that the third launch of the mega-rocket would take the space company's robotic lunar lander to the moon.

item.title: Spotify brings AI-powered Prompted Playlists to the U.S. and Canada
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Now available in the US and Canada, Spotify's AI-powered Prompted Playlists let users describe what they want to hear using natural language commands.

item.title: Snapchat gives parents new insights into teens’ screen time and friends
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: With these new features, Snap is likely looking to appease regulators and parents over concerns about safety and screen time on its platform.

item.title: Quadric rides the shift from cloud AI to on-device inference — and it’s paying off
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Quadric aims to help companies and governments build programmable on-device AI chips that can run fast-changing models locally.

item.title: Tiger Global, Microsoft to fully exit Walmart-backed PhonePe via its IPO
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Tiger Global and Microsoft are offering up their full stakes in the company, while Walmart is choosing to retain its majority stake, and selling up to 45.9 million shares.

item.title: Former Google trio is building an interactive AI-powered learning app for kids
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Big tech companies and upcoming startups want to use generative AI to build software and hardware for kids. A lot of those experiences are limited to text or voice, and kids might not find that captivating. Three former Google employees want to get over that hurdle with their generative AI-powered interactive app, Sparkli. Sparkli was […]

item.title: Not to be outdone by OpenAI, Apple is reportedly developing an AI wearable
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: Should this wearable materialize, it could be released as early as 2027, according to a report on the device.

item.title: Sources: Project SGLang spins out as RadixArk with $400M valuation as inference market explodes
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: SGLang, which originated as an open source research project at Ion Stoica’s UC Berkeley lab, has raised capital from Accel.

item.title: A timeline of the US semiconductor market in 2025
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: From leadership changes at legacy semiconductor companies to wishy washy policy around chip exports, a lot happened last year.

item.title: X copies Bluesky with a ‘Starterpacks’ feature that helps you find who to follow
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: X says the new feature, similar to Bluesky's Starter Packs, will arrive in the coming weeks.

item.title: Todoist’s app now lets you add tasks to your to-do list by speaking to its AI
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: The feature, now public, lets you create to-do's and action items by speaking naturally to the app's AI.

item.title: Apple plans to make Siri an AI chatbot, report says
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Siri could look more like ChatGPT than its current state as an integrated feature across Apple products.

item.title: Anthropic revises Claude’s ‘Constitution,’ and hints at chatbot consciousness
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: The newly revised document offers a roadmap for what Anthropic says is a safer and more helpful chatbot experience.

item.title: Apps for boycotting American products surge to the top of the Danish App Store
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: The boost in downloads comes as Danish consumers have been organizing a grassroots boycott of American-made products, which also included canceling their U.S. vacations and ditching their subscriptions to U.S.-based streaming services, like Netflix.

item.title: Irony alert: Hallucinated citations found in papers from NeurIPS, the prestigious AI conference
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Research from startup GPTZero points to the impossible problem prestigious conferences face in the age of AI slop.

item.title: Blue Origin’s satellite internet network TeraWave will move data at 6 Tbps
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: The network will be designed for enterprise, data center, and government customers and could offer an alternative to SpaceX's Starlink service.

item.title: Zipline charts drone delivery expansion with $600M in new funding
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: That geographic expansion in the United States has fueled Zipline’s delivery numbers. In 2024, the company completed 1 million drone deliveries to customers; this week, Zipline said it had surpassed 2 million deliveries.

item.title: OpenEvidence hits $12B valuation, with new round led by Thrive, DST
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: The medical info database has doubled in valuation since last raise in October, despite encroachment from model makers.

item.title: Threads rolls out ads to all users worldwide
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: The company has made it easy for existing advertisers to expand their reach to include Threads by allowing them to automatically place ads through both Meta's Advantage+ program and via manual campaigns.
